review: Now, if only I could root it to make getting config and log files off this thing easier.After tweaking the network buffer settings, XBMC/KODI 13.2 is running like a champ. Using a MySQL database on the backend for the library.Have yet to start Netflix, but so far, I am quite happy with this little unit.
author: W. A. Borrelli

review: This little item works very well for me. It's beyond easy to install and all the info pops right up on the TV screen.You connect the USB to your TV, turn it on and there is the setting menu. Use the included remote to install it to your WiFi network. If your network is secured, as it should be, you will have to remember your password. At first the screen jittered and I had a sinking feeling, Technically, I am not that adept. But, I do have a Fire tablet so I was able to get a program started from there and it immediately showed up on the TV. Magic!  Whatever is on the Fire HD tablet will show up on the TV. Subsequently, it works perfectly from the remote.This is really a terrific tool. I love it and I prefer watching my Amazon Prime movies on the TV. I eliminated cable a month or so ago, so the Fire TV stick is an integral part of my new viewing experience.
author: DrD

review: For what it is, it's great!  First rate fit and finish, smooth easy installation and an overall good experience.  It is very similar to Roku so it's not a huge step forward.  It does have great integration with Prime but is missing Slingbox and a few others that I like.  Since Amazon is fairly new I expect they will continue to add the apps and channels that make Roku so great.At $19 for Prime members it's a real deal.
author: Doc S. Hodges "Doc"

review: I've been using a Roku for a couple years now...I expected the Fire TV Stick to be more "impressive".  Not sure why, I just did.  But really...it's just a Roku, only a little smaller...not much to croon over.  But...it works, so I can't really say I don't like it.  It does seem to freeze up a little more often than the Roku did...jury is still out on whether or not that'll get better.
author: Matt "Boxless"

review: But it's limited on onscreen apps via remote control, and other Android app(s) are not integrated - far behind Apple and Google apps. Hope Amazon Prime makes an integrated app to view video and music, and allow the user to transfer content to TV in one app!
author: New Kid

review: First let me start off by saying that we LOVE our Amazon Fire TV (the $99 box).  We've had very little issues with it, and the issues we did have were most likely due to our older router.  We've since upgraded to the Netgear AC1900, and have had no issues with that box.That being said, I was excited to get the same basic functionality out of a $20 (got this during the 2-day sale) box.  I was sadly mistaken.  I'm having many connection issues (Won't connect to Netflix, Can't Connect to the Home Screen, etc.).  The Stick is in the same room as the box. The remote won't work most of the time, and when it does it is horribly sluggish.  Button presses don't register, or when they do they register as multiple button presses.  It took me more than 5 minutes to exit from Netflix back into the main page.In reading the reviews here, I see that there's a patch/firmware upgrade coming in the near future, so I'll hold out to see if that fixes the issues.  If it doesn't, I'm sad to say that it's going back home to Amazon.  Perhaps I'll find a Roku on a Deal of the Day before Christmas.
author: Charles Coverly

review: If you are looking to get your TV online to watch Amazon content or YouTube then this is the right device for you. I found this product comparable to the Chromecast or even better. The only missing feature is the ability to cast a browser or video from your computer. The fire stick does support the Plex app and helps alleviate some the casting shortcomings.
author: akumar

review: Setup was a pain, I had to enter wifi setups multiple times, it kept reboot, finally it did a software upgrade and after that it finally worked. It still cannot connect to my 5Ghz wifi though, only 2.4Ghz,However, now that it works it is great. It does everything I want it to do and it is very fast. I would recommend it to anyone who wants an easy way to watch Amazon instant video (havent tried any of the apps yet). Also, looking at my pictures in the amazon cloud works great too.
